contentrichtext.text: {{MedalTableTop}} {{MedalCountry | {{FRA}} }} {{MedalSport | Men's [[triathlon]]}} {{MedalCompetition|[[ITU Long Distance Triathlon World Championships|ITU Long Distance World Championships]]}} {{MedalSilver| 2007 Lorient | Elite men's race}} {{MedalBronze| 2003 Ibiza | Elite men's race}} {{MedalBronze| 2005 Fredericia | Elite men's race}} {{MedalBottom}} '''Xavier Le Floch''' is a [[France|French]] [[triathlon|triathlete]]. Le Floch won his first World Championships medal at the [[ITU Long Distance Triathlon World Championships]] in 2003, held in [[Ibiza]] where he finished in third position, claiming the bronze.<ref name="ITU">[[International Triathlon Union]]. [http://www.triathlon.org/athletes/profile/7048 "Xavier Le Floch | Triathlon.org"]. Retrieved on 25 May 2013.</ref> Two years later in [[Fredericia]] he would equal his effort and won his second bronze medal at the same event.<ref name="ITU" /> He won the silver medal at the 2007 Triathlon Long Distance World Championships in [[Lorient]],<ref name="ITU" /> beating his fellow country man [[Sebastien Berlier]] for the bronze medal, but finished behind [[Julien Loy]], also from France. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Le Floch, Xavier | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = French triathlete | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Le Floch, Xavier}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:French triathletes]] {{France-sport-bio-stub}} {{Triathlon-bio-stub}}
